channel.title: Roll up and water proof keyboard - 40$?!
channel.description:
[url]https://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16823336012[/url]
I wanted some opinions on this keyboard? I would strictly get it because I can wash it in my dishwasher and roll it up. Think it would be worth the $40?

item.description:
thats a lie. Everyone knows dolphins use firewire.

item.source: Roll up and water proof keyboard - 40$?!

item.title: Roll up and water proof keyboard - 40$?!
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
The block is not that annoying because there is a numpad between it and the regular key. Also it makes a nice central core to wrap up around.

Just a word of warning about deal extreme (if you haven’t ever purchased from them before) shipping will take a looooong time, so I hope you don’t need it in a hurry.

Read full topic
item.source: Roll up and water proof keyboard - 40$?!

item.title: Roll up and water proof keyboard - 40$?!
item.dc:creator: Victus
item.description:
All right, I’ll get the pink one. Worth it for 12.50$

EDIT: Wait, I’m not digging that big brick on the side of them. Though for the money, bleh. Would be fun to have. All we need now is an adapter for the iPhone

item.title: Roll up and water proof keyboard - 40$?!
item.dc:creator: Fnoigy
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

I’ve seen them go for 20 USD at the Boston Museum of Science.

Bullshit. Everything’s overpriced in the gift shop and you know it.

FireTime:

way cheaper here
https://www.dealextreme.com/details.dx/sku.13684-Yellow $10.73
https://www.dealextreme.com/details.dx/sku.7846 - blue $10.84
https://www.dealextreme.com/details.dx/sku.9346 - pink $12.50
https://www.dealextreme.com/details.dx/sku.42 - Grey $11.90

OP, GET THE PINK ONE.

item.title: Roll up and water proof keyboard - 40$?!
item.dc:creator: Deimos
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

I honestly don’t see the point in this for normal use anyways. Just buy a normal keyboard.

This, seriously.

Why buy a keyboard JUST because it can roll up and be washed in water with the risk it’s going to be crap.

item.source: Roll up and water proof keyboard - 40$?!

item.title: Roll up and water proof keyboard - 40$?!
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
way cheaper here
https://www.dealextreme.com/details.dx/sku.13684-Yellow $10.73
https://www.dealextreme.com/details.dx/sku.7846 - blue $10.84
https://www.dealextreme.com/details.dx/sku.9346 - pink $12.50
https://www.dealextreme.com/details.dx/sku.42 - Grey $11.90

as with everyone else, yes they are annoying to type on. I could not use one of those as my primary keyboard, you have to very deliberately push straight down on each key to make proper contact. The only reason I have one is I use it for our DJ computer in my fraternities basement because I was tired of beer being spilled on and killing all of our other keyboards.

But you do get +10 hacker status if you roll one of these out connected to a pda/netbook then connect that to your cellphone for internet. (also x2 multiplier of you swap sim cards in the process )

[COLOR=‘DimGray’]I’ve done this in-front as a bunch of students in a lecture hall, after looking up and seeing everyones faces all I could think of was, dam it feels good to be a gangster.

Read full topic

That and it’s just not comfortable at all for long periods of typing.

item.source: Roll up and water proof keyboard - 40$?!

item.title: Roll up and water proof keyboard - 40$?!
item.dc:creator: Picklesworth
item.description:
They’re just really tiring to type on, and the keys have next to no tactile feedback. Probably good if it’s for a computer in a dusty area (or maybe a wood shop?), but not very useful otherwise.

Besides, there’s a store near me that sells those for about $30 CAD off the shelf.

Read full topic
